Description:
Brand-new, spacious & raring to go!
Youll love:
This spacious home has never been lived in before & features 4 bedrooms, 2 living areas, plus a stunning kitchen with a walk-in pantry, subway tiles & large stone breakfast bar.
The main open plan living zone faces north and opens onto a sheltered alfresco area at the rear, also making it ideal for entertaining.
Additional peace & quiet thanks to the large master bedroom suite with walk-ins & ensuite, plus a second living room thats away from it all.
Other quality inclusions such as high ceilings, ducted central heating & ample storage solutions throughout, plus the split-system heating/cooling in the main living area.
Plus:
3 additional bedrooms with BIRs, a central bathroom, spacious laundry and a double remote garage & great side access.
Landscaped front yard & a sunny, low-maintenance backyard thats suitable for pets & has been planted with privacy in mind & includes exposed aggregate concrete driveway & paths around the whole of the home.
Conveniently located in a quiet & wide street in Quay 2 Estate, only minutes walk away from parks, playgrounds, shops, Torquay Farmers Market & more.
Enjoy extra peace of mind with a 6-month defects period included in the purchase of this newly-built home plus first home buyers are eligible to receive the $20,000 FHOG.
Insights: 10 Cahir Ave, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 139 other 4 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Top floor unit in a top location!
Youll love:
The cracking location of this top floor, 1-bedroom unit: right in the centre of Old Torquay and only a hop, skip & jump to the beach via Taylor Park.
The homes light, bright & airy feel, complemented by a leafy outlook from every window.
Soaking up the morning sun on your own private east-facing balcony, with a glimpse of the ocean past the trees visible too!
The kitchen is well-equipped & has a large island bench, while the adjoining lounge area includes a split system and is generous for the units overall size.
Plus:
The bedroom is well lit & offers extensive built-in robes.
The combined bathroom & laundry is spacious and includes a shower & a bathtub too.
Other features include the original polished timber floors & exposed brick wall, plus a single carport.
1-bedroom opportunities in 3228 are few & far between so dont miss this chance to own a slice of Old Torquay!
Insights: 5/20 Spring Street, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 2 other 1 bedroom unit in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Your Nest at the Top of the Tree
Conveniently located within an arms-reach of everything you could want for a relaxed lifestyle in one of Geelong's most tightly held suburbs, this beautifully maintained home could be ideal start, investment opportunity or downsizer.
Location aside, the flexible floorplan is the real winner here with not one but two living zones on offer, three spacious bedrooms that all feature built in robes with all serviced by a central two-way bathroom. Your light and bright open plan living, kitchen and dining is the centrepoint and soaks up all of that warm winter sun from the north.
The neat and tidy 360sqm allotment ensures that your weekends can be saved on mowing the lawns and spent out and about in central Geelong, on the Surf Coast or even shopping at the Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre which as all within a 15 minute drive. Want to leave the car at home? Why not - you're only a 5 minute walk to the Waurn Ponds Station to enjoy Melbourne's many spoils!
Further features include:
- Ducted heating and split system air conditioning
- Gas cooktop/electric oven & dishwasher
- Remote double lock up garaging with drive-thru access

Description:
Classic Barwon Heads Beach House
The Feel:
With a warm and welcoming Bohemian vibe, this unique 4 bedroom family home is filled with several cozy nooks to relax and daydream, with rarely offered wide open space that kids will love. Whether youre seeking an inventive space to get the creative juices flowing or just love to entertain, access to the outdoors is offered in abundance here and all just moments from the beaches and cafes that this prized location offers. If home is where the heart is, the relaxed Bohemian style of this unique coastal home will delight. Arrange your inspection today, and fall in love with this relaxed coastal lifestyle!
The Facts:
-Set on a rare 906sqm approx.
-4 BR, master inclusive on ensuite & access to northern deck
-Central kitchen with SMEG appliances & breakfast bar
-2 separate living spaces
-A bohemian kitchen garden
-Centrally accessed laundry,
-Ducted heating, ducted evaporative cooling & SSAC
The Owner Loves....
We love the old school beach feel of our home, the sense of space our lush gardens provide and the special spaces and nooks weve created to be enjoyed at different moments and for the different times in our lives.

Description:
Potential Plus in Desirable Belmont Pocket!
Set upon approximately 650m2 and boasting side lane access, this property presents buyers with a myriad of options! Whether you want to renovate the original home, wipe the slate clean to build your dream family abode, or use the expansive land size for development (STCA), this is the one for you!
Ideally positioned in a peaceful pocket of Belmont, this location will leave you wanting for nothing more. Families will be in their element with a wide selection of schools within walking distance, including Roslyn Primary School, Clairvaux Catholic School, Belmont High School and Barwon Valley School. The Stephen Street shops are just around the corner, while a short stroll will find you at the McDonald Reserve sporting grounds. To add to the conveniences, you will enjoy within each reach access to public transport, the High Street Shopping Precinct and Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre.
With the interiors in their charming original condition, the property has been re stumped & a new roofing & is overflowing with character and potential. The generous living room at the front of the home with its ornate lighting overlooks the calming and low maintenance front garden.
The kitchen exudes retro character with its built-in seating, while an oven and electric cooktop take care of your cooking needs. Overlooking the backyard, the sunroom is awash in Northern light. Three large bedrooms (one with built-in robes), bathroom, laundry and a separate toilet complete the layout. A gas wall heater and air conditioner provide comfort, while solar panels promote sustainable living.
The North-facing backyard provides a wealth of space for the vision of its future owners (STCA). The single carport offers undercover parking, while backyard vehicle access is another huge plus. The side lane way leads to a second carport, which is ideal for storing a caravan, trailer, or boat. The large powered workshop adds the finishing touch to this terrific property.
Don't miss this opportunity to make your mark in Belmont! Inspect without delay!
** ON The Market via online Auction; 'Openn Negotiation'. This online Auction process is open to all buyers, including those wanting to buy subject to finance or other potential conditions. This online auction is now active and underway. Contact Jess Templeton immediately to become enrolled to avoid any disappointment, as this property can sell at any time **
Roncon Real Estate Always ON!

Description:
RENOVATE OR DETONATE, YOU DECIDE!
Located just a short 5-minute drive to the Geelong CBD & within walking distance of the high street shopping strip comes this 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom home on a perfect 718m2 (approx) parcel of land.
Depending on what you are hoping to achieve, this home could either make the perfect fixer upper, or the ideally located subdivision (STCA).
The master bedroom is located to the front of the home and comes with an ensuite and WIR.
The other two bedrooms come with BIR's.
With so much potential this home is a must on your inspection list!

PSP Property Group is proud to introduce this fantastic property for sale in Marshall Draft PSP. Golden opportunity for any Developers, Investors and Land Bankers to secure this ideal parcel close to all services and amenities.
The Property features:
* Located within one of the fastest growing corridors in Melbourne
* A rare development opportunity in Marshall UGZ
* Neighbouring residential estates such as Watermark, Ashbury and Warralily
* Stone throw away from Horseshoe Bend PSP
* Minutes from Geelong CBD, beaches and all other amenities
* Walking distance to Marshall train station
* Easy access to Melbourne via Princess Hwy
* Approx 25 minutes to Avalon airport

Description:
Calling All Families, Tradies & Hobby Farmers!
Occupying approx. 1.4 acres, this property presents a terrific opportunity for families, tradies, and hobby farmers alike! The large shed accommodates four vehicles, while a paddock and animal pen are located at the rear of the property!
Both Moolap Primary School and Moolap Reserve are within walking distance, while easy access to public transport and the Bellarine Highway shops is a huge plus. Situated on the border of Moolap industrial zone, this property also offers immense value for commercial businesses searching for extra space.
With all of the living zones overlooking the sheltered alfresco and side yard, parents will love that they can keep an eye on little ones as they play outside. A wall-to-wall bookcase makes a stylish statement in the front lounge, which is awash in natural light. The kitchen is well equipped with a built-in pantry and appliances (F&P dishwasher, St.George wall oven and 900mm electric cooktop). The dining area opens onto the sheltered alfresco for casual indoor-outdoor living. Graced with a wood heater, the spacious living room unites with both the sheltered alfresco and rear sun-drenched deck providing effortless entertaining options!
Zoned to the rear of the home for privacy, the generous Master Bedroom features a walk-in robe and en suite. Three additional bedrooms with built-in robes share close access to the main bathroom, while the laundry and separate toilet complete the layout. Ducted heating and refrigerated cooling keep you in the utmost comfort. The remote double lock-up garage features a built-in office.
With the expansive backyard wrapping around the entire home, a wonderland is created for the whole family to enjoy. Nestled under the trees, the fire pit provides the perfect setting for a cold winter night. Parents will appreciate that the yard can be sectioned off from the rear paddocks to create a secure space for children and pets. The separate games room and rumpus room, complete with a wood heater, put the foundations in place for lively gatherings. Complete with a built-in workbench, the shed accommodates four vehicles plus plenty of room for a workshop. The rear paddock and animal pen will delight hobby farmers.
With so much to offer, youll need to act swiftly to secure this property! Inspect ASAP!
Insights: 38 High Street, Moolap VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020.

Address: 1034 Horse Shoe Bend Road Torquay VIC 3228
Description:
RELAXED RURAL LIFESTYLE IN VIBRANT TORQUAY.
The Phone Code for this property is: 57302. Please quote this number when phoning or texting.
BE QUICK as there is seldom an opportunity to purchase land of this size & quality so close to Torquay.
This 7,000 square metre (approx.) property is situated on Horseshoe Bend Road only a few minutes' drive (3 KM) to the beautiful beaches or Torquay township. Surrounded by 5 acre well established properties with long standing trees & gardens which provide privacy in a country style setting.
There are well established native trees providing screening right along the frontage to Horseshoe Bend Road and some mature gum trees on the property giving character to the land. The area is flat for building economy and there is an possibly opportunity to glimpse ocean views from a 2nd storey.
The opportunities here are wide ranging and you could build your dream home with a generous garage yet still have plenty of room for a pool, spa, tennis court, fruit orchard, vegetables patch, have horses, alpacas or indulge your visions of what life living here could be.
Torquay is small enough to have a real community spirit but is growing fast and gaining many new neighbourhood facilities, schools & varied cafes & restaurants adding a vibrant buzz to this naturally beautiful coastal town.
Enjoy everything Torquay has to offer on your own spacious land where you can create your own lifestyle.
Be sure to click on the play VIDEO button see fully what this land has to offer.
Contact us today to register your interest.
Insights: 1034 Horse Shoe Bend Road, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Bespoke Hinterland Haven
PRIVATE INSPECTION OR VIRTUAL TOUR WELCOME
A desire to tread lightly in the environment, embrace sustainability and leading-edge design has produced not only an outstanding home, but a serene and private sanctuary. This hinterland haven offers an inspiring architectural masterpiece that gently nestles into and showcases the picturesque 27.67acre (approx) bush clad surrounds.
This stunning Hinterland House by Victorian architect Mike Morris has an extensive list of features including the voluminous open plan living zone that is optimally positioned for passive climate control, and for full enjoyment of the carefully restored landscape. Rich timber accents combine with polished concrete flooring and natural tones of rammed earth to create an invitingly relaxed yet sophisticated and contemporary feel. Under floor hydronic heating and an open fire keep things warm in winter, while summers are for enjoying the gentle cross breezes and a choice of outdoor entertaining areas. European appliances and a temperature regulated walk-in pantry in the centrally located kitchen help to make hosting family and friends effortless. As does the separate guest wing complete with two light filled bedrooms and a bathroom featuring handmade glass tiles.
The master suite is a tranquil retreat with stunning views across the dam. Floor to ceiling glazing blurs the lines between indoors and out; while the sliding doors in the adjoining en-suite open fully for stargazing while relaxing in the freestanding stone bath. Currently configured as an idyllic home office with an adjoining creative studio, the Spotted Gum clad annexe has a flexible nature and would work equally well as a second separate living area.
Outdoors the practical features include a fully enclosed architecturally designed vegetable garden with automated irrigation; a three bay implement shed with carport; wood storage sheds; underground water storage tanks; and a state-of-the-art worm farm waste processing unit.
There is a myriad of opportunities to make the most of the rejuvenated native bush setting. Unwind and entertain on either the north or west facing terraces; enjoy dining outdoors in the fully screened open air sunroom; or meander along walkways that wind through Banksia groves and around the three acre dam.
Located 30 minutes from Geelong and just moments to world-class ocean beaches, this property is a unique opportunity to reap the rewards of a life ensconced in a nature filled hideaway. This is the place to be, to live, to holiday to work or some of each. Inspection by appointment only.
Insights: 1110 Great Ocean Road, Bellbrae VIC 3228 was last sold in 2006.

Description:
Potential & Period Charm A Heartbeat From High Street.
Overflowing with period charm and potential, this character home invites you to embrace the Belmont lifestyle youve been craving! Recent updates to the propertys exterior inspire contemporary family living, while the inside is awaiting the vision of its future owners (STCA).
With the High Street shopping precinct only a short stroll away, you dont have to venture far to treat yourself or run some errands. A wide selection of cafes and restaurants are yours to enjoy whenever you please, while an abundance of shops and big-brand stores put the practical elements in place. Oberon P.S. and Belmont P.S. are within walking distance for young families, while Belmont High School is wonderfully close by. Public transport is footsteps from your front door. Enjoy living moments from the Barwon River and Barwon Valley Golf Club.
High ceilings, decorative plasterwork and leadlight windows reflect the homes history. Floorboards grace the front lounge and central dining room, while the kitchen is well equipped with a stainless steel dishwasher and Artusi oven/gas cooktop. Two bedrooms feature built-in robes, while the spacious third bedroom boasts direct access to the rear deck. The bathroom, laundry and separate toilet complete the layout. Ducted heating, a gas wall heater, two air conditioners and ceiling fans keep you comfortable in all seasons.
Freshly landscaped gardens grace the front yard, while the new deck and sun-drenched backyard have been designed for modern family living. The new exposed aggregate driveway provides vehicle access to the backyard, while the single carport and remote single lock-up garage are accessed via a side lane.
Whether you plan to move straight in or add your own personal touch, this Belmont abode is positioned for a superb lifestyle.
Insights: 51 Roslyn Road, Belmont VIC 3216 was last sold in 2006 and 182 other 3 bedroom house in Belmont have recently been sold.

Description:
Family Home in a Court location 809sqm
On approximately 809m2 of land this home represents excellent value for the larger family who need that little bit of extra space both inside and out.
On offer is this solid brick home with a large formal area complete with wood burner and ducted evaporative cooling. In addition, a 2nd family room, equipped with fantastic storage and direct access to the garden.
The kitchen has undergone a transformation and has glossy white cabinet's, dishwasher, gas cook top, electric wall oven, plenty of bench space, storage and a display cabinet. This is a great space for casual meals which also leads to the pergola area and fernery.
All four bedrooms are double in size and 3 have built in robes, (master with ensuite). The family bathroom is bright and fresh with a luxurious spa bath. As you would expect, the laundry is well equipped with bench space and storage. The gardens are well established and provide two sheds, lovely fruit trees and a secure private parking in a large oversized single garage.
Situated in close proximity to Deakin University, Epworth Hospital, Oberon primary and high school, the Ring Road as well both the Highton and Waurn Ponds Shopping complexes.
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.

Description:
Dream Home or Prime Development, 3027m2 (RGZ2 Zoning)
This substantial family home with an impressive four car garage and in ground pool is in solid, original condition and is situated on an outstanding 3027m2 (approx.) allotment with Residential Growth Zone Schedule 2 zoning. Whether you're looking for your dream family home in need of some work offering the best of lifestyle and location or a potential development opportunity subject to council approval, this property is pure real estate gold! The Waurn Ponds Creek Trail is located at the rear of this property and offers short walking distance to the Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre. Deakin, Epworth and the Geelong Ring Road access are also within easy reach.
A substantial family home with three bedrooms with built-in robes and study or fourth bedroom, two bathrooms, two substantial living areas, central kitchen and two dining areas. Ducted heating and a combustion wood heater provide comfort throughout. The four-car garage is an enviable 13.5 x 7m (approx.) and an in-ground pool completes the picture.
In this location with so much on offer, this could very well be a once in a lifetime opportunity. Act now!

Description:
Custom 90s home in a serene pocket.
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING COVID-19:
Open for inspections will no longer be scheduled for the public. To organise your own private viewing, please contact Deane Hughes on 0407 926 659 or Kingston Wade on 0438 033 999.
Occupying 988m2 of elevated land, this unique and imposing home has been cleverly designed to capture natural light from every angle and is sure to tick the boxes for those searching for space, privacy and something a little bit special.
Grand feature ceilings and seamless floor to ceiling windows capture stunning views over the region and the UV blocking tint provides both privacy and year-round energy efficiency.
On entry, the beautiful formal living and dining area is light-filled and spacious and leads through to the large, open plan kitchen, living and dining area. The unique kitchen offers plentiful storage and an conservatory-style ceiling that captures the warming morning sun and overlooks the tranquil backyard greenery.
Accommodation is well-appointed and offers a large master bedroom with a walk-in robe and ensuite with spa-bath and light-catching glass bricks. Two further bedrooms both offer large built-in robes and are conveniently serviced by a central bathroom with separate toilet. A potential forth bedroom or study is located adjacent to the master, and could be a perfect nursery.
Outside, the stunning backyard offers year-round greenery and privacy, with plenty of space for the kids and pets to run around, the possibility of a pool (STCA), and of course, entertaining family and friends in the Boston Ivy-draped trellis-style alfresco.
Notable features include:
- Split system air-conditioning in living and main bedroom.
- Ducted gas heating throughout.
- Huge double garage with adjoining workshop / third car space.
- Off-street parking for a further 5 cars in the driveway.
- New paint throughout.
- New carpet throughout.
- New Blinds throughout.
Located within 5 minutes of Leopold's Gateway Plaza, just 15 minutes to the Geelong Waterfront, 10 minutes to the Bellarine Peninsula, and with easy access to some of Geelong's finest schools, this feature-packed property showcases the superior blend of convenience, practicality, outdoor living, in one of Geelong's most popular suburbs. Enquire today!
To book your private inspection please contact Deane Hughes on 0407 926 659 or Kingston Wade on 0438 033 999.
Insights: 5-9 Townview Court, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020 and 94 other 4 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
Dress circle townhouse, own title.
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING COVID-19:
Open for inspections will no longer be scheduled for the public. To organise your own private viewing, please contact Cam Foster on 0406 597 050.
A fantastic opportunity to secure a charming property on its own title and in one of Belmont's most prestigious positions. This brick veneer home features two bedrooms, both with built in robes. Stylish kitchen complete with gas cooktop & oven, dishwasher, split system and ample cupboard/bench space which overlooks the dining area, leading into a spacious lounge area with gas heater. The central bathroom is complete with bath and shower, plus a generous laundry with external access completes the layout of this property.
Outdoor/indoor entertaining is seamless with direct access out onto the north/westerly facing alfresco deck area, perfect for hosting friends and family all year round. Outside also provides you with a low maintenance secure courtyard with a single car garage & a private front yard with established gardens.
This prized Belmont location is walking distance to local primary/secondary schools, public transport & shopping along High Street or the Highton Village. Perfect for downsizers, first home buyers or as an investment & ready to move in, this home is one not to be missed.

Description:
Opportunity Is Knocking In Belmont.
Set upon approx. 685m2, this property presents buyers with a myriad of options. Move straight in, renovate to create your dream family home, secure your next investment property, or even use the generous land size for development (STCA) the choice is yours.
Ideally positioned in a Belmont hotspot, this location will leave you wanting nothing. A short walk places you in the bustling hub of High Street, where youll be spoilt for choice with a wide variety of cafes, restaurants, boutiques and supermarkets. Families will be in their element with Oberon P.S, Belmont High School and Barwon Valley School all within easy walking distance. Public transport is footsteps away, while Winter Reserve is close by for sporting enthusiasts. Easy access to the Barwon River and Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre adds the final touch to this fantastic locale.
The front porch welcomes you into the home, while the interiors feature polished floorboards and timber paneling to the hallway. Northern light sweeps through the open plan living/dining/kitchen zone, which creates the cosy heart of the home. The kitchen is well equipped with a built-in pantry and cooking appliances (oven, gas cooktop, rangehood). Three bedrooms with built-in robes are serviced by the main bathroom, which is complete with a single vanity and combined bath/shower. The laundry and separate toilet are positioned at the rear of the home. A wall heater, split-system air conditioner and ceiling fans keep your comfortable in all seasons.
Outside, the paved alfresco puts the foundations in place for casual outdoor living relax under the shade of the tree in summer or snuggle around the fire pit during the colder months! Overflowing with potential, the generous backyard is home to a cubby house and sandpit. Parents will appreciate that they can close the front gate to create another secure play space in the front yard. The single carport and single lock-up garage provide parking, while two garden sheds offer plenty of storage.
With so much to offer, youll need to act swiftly to secure this Belmont gem.
Insights: 263 High Street, Belmont VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 182 other 3 bedroom house in Belmont have recently been sold.
